info.description: A [Manager Account](https://advertising.amazon.com/help?ref_=a20m_us_blog_whtsnewfb2020_040120#GU3YDB26FR7XT3C8) lets you manage a group of Amazon Advertising accounts.
info.title: Manager Account

post.summary: Unlink Amazon Advertising accounts or advertisers with a Manager Account.
post.description: Unlink Amazon Advertising accounts or advertisers with a [Manager Account](https://advertising.amazon.com/help?ref_=a20m_us_blog_whtsnewfb2020_040120#GU3YDB26FR7XT3C8).

207.description: **Multi-Status** - Some Advertising accounts or advertisers may not have been linked successfully.

400.description: **Bad Request** - request failed because invalid parameters were provided. Ensure that all required parameters were provided.

401.description: **Unauthorized** - request failed because user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

403.description: **Forbidden** - request failed because user does not have access to a specified resource.

429.description: **Too Many Requests** - request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: **Internal Service Error** - something failed in the server. Please try again later. If the issue persists, report an error.

parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId
parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account. This is a required header for advertisers and integrators using the Advertising API.

post.summary: Creates a new Amazon Advertising Manager account.

requestBody.description: Request object required to create a new Manager account.

400.description: **Bad Request** - request failed because invalid parameters were provided. Ensure that all required parameters were provided.

403.description: **Forbidden** - request failed because the caller was not authorized to create a Manager account.

429.description: **Too Many Requests** - request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: **Internal Service Error** - something failed in the server. Please try again later. If the issue persists, report an error.

parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId
parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account. This is a required header for advertisers and integrators using the Advertising API.

get.summary: Returns all Manager accounts that a given Amazon Advertising user has access to.
get.description: Returns all [Manager accounts](https://advertising.amazon.com/help?ref_=a20m_us_blog_whtsnewfb2020_040120#GU3YDB26FR7XT3C8) that a user has access to, along with metadata for all of the Amazon Advertising accounts that are linked to the Manager account.

400.description: **Bad Request** - request failed because invalid parameters were provided. Ensure that all required parameters were provided.

401.description: **Unauthorized** - request failed because user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

403.description: **Forbidden** - request failed because user does not have access to a specified resource

429.description: **Too Many Requests** - request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: **Internal Service Error** - something failed in the server. Please try again later. If the issue persists, report an error.

parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId
parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account. This is a required header for advertisers and integrators using the Advertising API.

post.summary: Link Amazon Advertising accounts or advertisers with a Manager Account.
post.description: Link Amazon Advertising accounts or advertisers with a [Manager Account](https://advertising.amazon.com/help?ref_=a20m_us_blog_whtsnewfb2020_040120#GU3YDB26FR7XT3C8).

207.description: **Multi-Status** - Some Advertising accounts or advertisers may not have been linked successfully.

400.description: **Bad Request** - request failed because invalid parameters were provided. Ensure that all required parameters were provided.

401.description: **Unauthorized** - request failed because user is not authenticated or is not allowed to invoke the operation.

403.description: **Forbidden** - request failed because user does not have access to a specified resource.

429.description: **Too Many Requests** - request was rate-limited. Retry later.

500.description: **Internal Service Error** - something failed in the server. Please try again later. If the issue persists, report an error.

parameters.name: Amazon-Advertising-API-ClientId
parameters.description: The identifier of a client associated with a "Login with Amazon" account. This is a required header for advertisers and integrators using the Advertising API.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

Account.description: Object representation of an Amazon Advertising account.

marketplaceId.description: The identifier of the marketplace to which the account is associated. See [this table](https://docs.developer.amazonservices.com/en_US/dev_guide/DG_Endpoints.html) for `marketplaceId` mappings.

accountId.description: Id of the Amazon Advertising account.

accountName.description: The name given to the Amazon Advertising account.

profileId.description: The identifier of a profile associated with the advertiser account. Note that this value is only populated for a subset of account types: `[ SELLER, VENDOR, MARKETING_CLOUD ]`. It will be `null` for accounts of other types.

dspAdvertiserId.description: The identifier of a DSP advertiser. Note that this value is only populated for accounts with type `DSP_ADVERTISING_ACCOUNT`. It will be `null` for accounts of other types.

ManagerAccount.description: Object representation of an Amazon Advertising Manager Account.

managerAccountName.description: The name given to a Manager Account.

AccountToUpdateFailure.description: Object representation of an Amazon Advertising account or [DSP advertiser](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/dsp-advertiser/#/) that failed to update.

CreateManagerAccountRequest.description: Request object that defines the fields required to create a Manager account.

managerAccountType.description: Type of the Manager account, which indicates how the Manager account will be used. Use `Advertiser` if the Manager account will be used for **your own** products and services, or `Agency` if you are managing accounts **on behalf of your clients**.

UpdateAdvertisingAccountsInManagerAccoun.description: A list of Advertising accounts or advertisers to link/unlink with [Manager Account](https://advertising.amazon.com/help?ref_=a20m_us_blog_whtsnewfb2020_040120#GU3YDB26FR7XT3C8). User can pass a list with a maximum of 20 accounts/advertisers using any mix of identifiers.

accounts.description: List of Advertising accounts or advertisers to link/unlink with [Manager Account](https://advertising.amazon.com/help?ref_=a20m_us_blog_whtsnewfb2020_040120#GU3YDB26FR7XT3C8). User can pass a list with a maximum of 20 accounts/advertisers using any mix of identifiers.

AccountRelationshipRole.description: The type of a role used in account relationships.

AccountType.description: Type of the Amazon Advertising account.

AccountToUpdate.description:
String identifier for an Amazon Advertising account or advertiser. `ACCOUNT_ID` is an identifier that is returned by the [Profiles resource](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/reference/2/profiles#/Profiles/listProfiles), within the `AccountInfo.id` data member. `ACCOUNT_ID` may begin with the string `"ENTITY"`.
`DSP_ADVERTISER_ID` is an identifier for a DSP advertiser, which is returned by the [DSP resource](https://advertising.amazon.com/API/docs/en-us/dsp-advertiser/#/Advertiser/get_dsp_advertisers).

roles.description: The types of role that will exist with the Amazon Advertising account. Depending on account type, the default role will be ENTITY_USER or SELLER_USER. Only one role at a time is currently supported

id.description: Id of the Amazon Advertising account.

GetManagerAccountsResponse.description: Response containing a list of Manager Accounts that a given user has access to.

managerAccounts.description: List of Manager Accounts that the user has access to

UpdateAdvertisingAccountsInManagerAccoun.description: Link/Unlink Advertising account or advertiser Response

failedAccounts.description: List of Advertising accounts or advertisers failed to Link/Unlink with [Manager Account](https://advertising.amazon.com/help?ref_=a20m_us_blog_whtsnewfb2020_040120#GU3YDB26FR7XT3C8).

succeedAccounts.description: List of Advertising accounts or advertisers successfully Link/Unlink with [Manager Account](https://advertising.amazon.com/help?ref_=a20m_us_blog_whtsnewfb2020_040120#GU3YDB26FR7XT3C8).
